data.title: Moscow
data.meta_description: Chapter 2 consists of Liu’s diaries from his departure for China’s Moscow embassy in June 1940 to his recall to China in December 1944. Here he records his work as embassy counsellor both in Moscow and in the city of Kuibyshev (Samara) on the Volga, where...
data.text:
Abstract

Chapter 2 consists of Liu’s diaries from his departure for China’s Moscow embassy in June 1940 to his recall to China in December 1944. Here he records his work as embassy counsellor both in Moscow and in the city of Kuibyshev (Samara) on the Volga, where foreign missions were relocated after the German invasion. This section also describes Liu’s trip via Central Asia to China in 1943 for talks with Chiang Kai-shek and other senior GMD officials.
